gov.va.med.lom.foundation.util

Class AssertionUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.va.med.lom.foundation.util.AssertionUtils

  • public final class AssertionUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods in support of assertions. The methods in this class are null-safe, i.e. the tested values may be null.

      • isAssignableFrom

        public static boolean isAssignableFrom(java.lang.Object value,
                       java.lang.Class clazz)
        Checks if the Class of the given object is assignable from a reference Class.
        Parameters:
        value - The object to check.
        clazz - The reference Class.
        Returns:
        True if value, it's Class and clazz are not null and value is assignable from clazz; false otherwise.

      • isAssignableFrom

        public static boolean isAssignableFrom(java.lang.Class value,
                       java.lang.Class clazz)
        Checks if the given Class is assignable from a reference Class.
        Parameters:
        value - The Class to check.
        clazz - The reference Class.
        Returns:
        True if value and clazz are not null and value is assignable from clazz; false otherwise.

      • isPositive

        public static boolean isPositive(java.lang.Number value)
        Checks if the given number is positive, that is > 0. Properly handles the following classes:
        • Byte
        • Short
        • Integer
        • Long
        • Float
        • Double
        • BigInteger (and derivatives that adhere to the Comparator interface)
        • BigDecimal(and derivatives that adhere to the Comparator interface)
        • AtomicInteger
        • AtomicLong
        Parameters:
        value - The value to check
        Returns:
        True is value is not null and its value > 0.

      • isPositiveOrZero

        public static boolean isPositiveOrZero(java.lang.Number value)
        Checks if the given number is positive or 0, that is >= 0.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to check
        Returns:
        True is value is not null and its value >= 0.

      • isNegative

        public static boolean isNegative(java.lang.Number value)
        Checks if the given number is negative, that is < 0.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to check
        Returns:
        True is value is not null and its value < 0.

      • isNegativeOrZero

        public static boolean isNegativeOrZero(java.lang.Number value)
        Checks if the given Integer is number or 0, that is <= 0.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to check
        Returns:
        True is value is not null and its value <= 0.

      • isBetween

        public static boolean isBetween(java.lang.Number value,
                java.lang.Number lowerBound,
                java.lang.Number upperBound)
        Checks if the given number value lies between an lower and an upper bound value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to check
        lowerBound - The lowerbound value. Value must be > lowerBound. If lowerbound is null, negative infinity is assumed.
        upperBound - The upperbound value. Value must be < upperBound. If upperbound is null, infinity is assumed.
        Returns:
        True is value is not null and its integer value < lowerBound and > upperBound.

      • isBefore

        public static boolean isBefore(java.util.Date value,
               java.util.Date before)
        Checks if the given argument is before a given date.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the argument to check.
        beforeorEqual - The date which must be preceded by value.
        Returns:
        True when value precedes the given before date; false otherwise.

      • isBeforeOrOn

        public static boolean isBeforeOrOn(java.util.Date value,
                   java.util.Date beforeOrOn)
        Checks if the given argument is before or on a given date.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the argument to check.
        beforeorEqual - The date which must be preceded by value or value must be on this date.
        Returns:
        True when value precedes or is on the given beforeOrEqual date; false otherwise.

      • isAfter

        public static boolean isAfter(java.util.Date value,
              java.util.Date after)
        Checks if the given argument is after a given date.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the argument to validate
        after - The date which must be preceded by value.
        Returns:
        True when value is a date that is after the given after date; false otherwise.

      • isAfterOrOn

        public static boolean isAfterOrOn(java.util.Date value,
                  java.util.Date afterOrOn)
        Checks if the given argument is after or on a given date.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the argument to check.
        AfterorEqual - The date which must be preceded by value or value must be on this date.
        Returns:
        True When the value is a date that is after or on the given afterOrEqual date; false otherwise.
